Here is an ordinary code cell demonstrating `confint.lm`.
Revealjs scales content down to `0.55 em`. Perhaps this should be emulated for qwebr-editor cells? I actually don't like it... Added an extra css for adjusting back to `1 em`.
```{r}
#| echo: true
fit = lm(mpg ~ am, data = mtcars)

confint(fit)
```


This is a webR-enabled code cell in a Quarto HTML document, with autorun (üëç to autorun!). Another option would be that the editor div inherits font size from quartos output. Then font-scale is relative to that one.

```{webr-r}
#| autorun: true
fit = lm(mpg ~ am, data = mtcars)

confint(fit)
```  

## Now in a div with scaling
